data.name: Archery Range
data.description: Produces ranged infantry units.

data.description: Produces melee infantry units.

data.name: Buddhist Temple
data.description: Produces the Buddhist Monk and houses Unique Buddhist technologies. Starting in the Castle Age (III), religious units can pick up Relics and place them in this building to generate Gold.

variations.name: Buddhist Temple
variations.description: Produces the Buddhist Monk and houses Unique Buddhist technologies. Starting in the Castle Age (III), religious units can pick up Relics and place them in this building to generate Gold.

data.name: Capital Town Center
data.description:
All Resources can be dropped off here. Produces Villagers, Scouts, and increases your maximum Population. Adds additional attacks while garrisoned.
Capital Town Centers can detect units stealth or disguises.

variations.name: Capital Town Center
variations.description:
All Resources can be dropped off here. Produces Villagers, Scouts, and increases your maximum Population. Adds additional attacks while garrisoned.
Capital Town Centers can detect units stealth or disguises.

data.name: Castle
data.description: Heavy garrison and defensible position equipped with a powerful Rocket, which deals high damage to a single target. Can be upgraded with weaponry. Adds additional attacks while garrisoned.

variations.name: Castle
variations.description: Heavy garrison and defensible position equipped with a powerful Rocket, which deals high damage to a single target. Can be upgraded with weaponry. Adds additional attacks while garrisoned.

data.name: Castle of the Crow
data.description: Acts as a Castle. Can periodically spawn Treasure Caravans from selected neutral Trading Posts to provide a large amount of Food, Wood, Gold, and some Stone when reaching the Castle of the Crow.

variations.name: Castle of the Crow
variations.description: Acts as a Castle. Can periodically spawn Treasure Caravans from selected neutral Trading Posts to provide a large amount of Food, Wood, Gold, and some Stone when reaching the Castle of the Crow.

data.name: Dock
data.description:
Produces naval units.
Automatically repairs nearby damaged naval units.
Capable of holding up to three fishing ships.
Fishing Boats are produced 25% cheaper.

variations.name: Dock
variations.description:
Produces naval units.
Automatically repairs nearby damaged naval units.
Capable of holding up to three fishing ships.
Fishing Boats are produced 25% cheaper.

data.name: Farm
data.description:
Harvestable Food source. Use a Villager to gather Food from the Farm.
Only one Villager can work each Farm.

variations.name: Farm
variations.description:
Harvestable Food source. Use a Villager to gather Food from the Farm.
Only one Villager can work each Farm.

data.name: Farmhouse
data.description: Increases your maximum Population and Villagers can drop-off Food at this building. Contains technologies to improve Food gathering.

variations.name: Farmhouse
variations.description: Increases your maximum Population and Villagers can drop-off Food at this building. Contains technologies to improve Food gathering.

data.name: Floating Gate
data.description:
Produces a Shinto Priest carrying a Yorishiro every 2 minutes. The first priest spawns instantly. Deposit up to 4 Yorishiro in buildings to provide unique bonuses.
 
Unlocks Shinto Shrines, which contains unique Shinto technologies and produces Shinto Priests.

variations.name: Floating Gate
variations.description:
Produces a Shinto Priest carrying a Yorishiro every 2 minutes. The first priest spawns instantly. Deposit up to 4 Yorishiro in buildings to provide unique bonuses.
 
Unlocks Shinto Shrines, which contains unique Shinto technologies and produces Shinto Priests.

data.name: Forge
data.description: Villagers can drop-off Stone and Gold at this building. Houses technologies to improve mining and military units.

variations.name: Forge
variations.description: Villagers can drop-off Stone and Gold at this building. Houses technologies to improve mining and military units.

data.name: Koka Township
data.description: Can produce Shinobi espionage units which specialize in scouting, sabotage, and assassination. Queues production of a free Shinobi upon completion.

variations.name: Koka Township
variations.description: Can produce Shinobi espionage units which specialize in scouting, sabotage, and assassination. Queues production of a free Shinobi upon completion.

data.name: Kura Storehouse
data.description: Universal drop-off location that creates a Farm around the Landmark every 50 seconds — generates Wood instead when farmland becomes full.

variations.name: Kura Storehouse
variations.description: Universal drop-off location that creates a Farm around the Landmark every 50 seconds — generates Wood instead when farmland becomes full.

data.name: Market
data.description: Allows the buying and selling of resources and produces the Trader.

data.name: Outpost
data.description: Offers extensive line of sight and detects units stealth or disguises. Can be upgraded with weaponry and fortifications. Attacks while garrisoned.

variations.name: Outpost
variations.description: Offers extensive line of sight and detects units stealth or disguises. Can be upgraded with weaponry and fortifications. Attacks while garrisoned.

data.name: Palisade Gate
data.description: Light defensive gate. Must be built on a Palisade Wall segment.

variations.name: Palisade Gate
variations.description: Light defensive gate. Must be built on a Palisade Wall segment.

data.name: Palisade Wall
data.description:
Light defensive wall for quickly fortifying an area.
Initially costs 21 Wood, with each additional section costing 7 Wood.

variations.name: Palisade Wall
variations.description:
Light defensive wall for quickly fortifying an area.

data.description: Produces cavalry military units.

data.name: Stone Wall
data.description:
Sturdy wall that cannot be attacked by torches. 
Units on walls take 25% less damage from ranged attacks, 50% less damage from siege attacks, and their range is increased by +1.

variations.name: Stone Wall
variations.description:
Sturdy wall that cannot be attacked by torches. 
Units on walls take 25% less damage from ranged attacks, 50% less damage from siege attacks, and their range is increased by +1.

data.name: Stone Wall Gate
data.description:
Heavy defensive gate. Must be built on a Stone Wall segment.
Infantry can use the gate to access the top of the walls.

variations.name: Stone Wall Gate
variations.description:
Heavy defensive gate. Must be built on a Stone Wall segment.
Infantry can use the gate to access the top of the walls.

data.name: Stone Wall Tower
data.description:
Heavy defensive tower that fires a springald. Must be built on a Stone Wall segment.
Infantry can use the tower to access the top of the walls.

variations.name: Stone Wall Tower
variations.description:
Heavy defensive tower that fires a springald. Must be built on a Stone Wall segment.
Infantry can use the tower to access the top of the walls.

data.name: Tanegashima Gunsmith
data.description: Stockpiles weapon supplies every 30 seconds that can be used to instantly produce gunpowder units - comes with 2 stockpiles. Produces Ozutsu, a unique heavy ranged gunpowder infantry with siege damage. Allows access to Ribauldequins.

variations.name: Tanegashima Gunsmith
variations.description: Stockpiles weapon supplies every 30 seconds that can be used to instantly produce gunpowder units - comes with 2 stockpiles. Produces Ozutsu, a unique heavy ranged gunpowder infantry with siege damage. Allows access to Ribauldequins.

data.name: Temple of Equality
data.description:
Produces Buddhist Monks and contains unique Buddhist technologies. Buddhist Monks provide support in combat by decreasing enemy damage with Sohei's Sutra and by enhancing damage of allies with Buddhist Conversion.
 
Also allows construction of 4 additional Buddhist Temples.

variations.name: Temple of Equality
variations.description:
Produces Buddhist Monks and contains unique Buddhist technologies. Buddhist Monks provide support in combat by decreasing enemy damage with Sohei's Sutra and by enhancing damage of allies with Buddhist Conversion.
 
Also allows construction of 4 additional Buddhist Temples.

data.name: Tokugawa Shrine
data.description: Build and defend a Wonder to secure victory. Rival civilizations will be aware of its construction and seek to destroy it.

variations.name: Tokugawa Shrine
variations.description: Build and defend a Wonder to secure victory. Rival civilizations will be aware of its construction and seek to destroy it.
